title: STEM-Computational Thinking Integrated Instructional Design for Special Education Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic teaching experience in special education settings and foundational understanding of STEM fields
context.additional_context: A program focusing on STEM-computational thinking integrated instructional design to support students with hearing and visual impairments, utilizing collaborative digital pedagogy and experiential learning to enhance self-efficacy

learning_goals: Learners improve their ability to design STEM-computational thinking integrated lessons that consider the characteristics of students with hearing and visual impairments.
Learners develop the ability to create and apply experiential instructional materials using collaborative digital tools.
Learners generate teachable-learning models immediately applicable in special education settings through project-based assessments.

resources: Free/Low-Cost Digital Collaboration Tools (e.g., Google Workspace for Education)
Accessibility-Supported STEM-Computing Manipulatives (3D-Printed Models, Sound-Vibration Conversion Sensors, etc.)
Case Study Materials (STEM Instruction Examples for Students with Hearing/Vision Impairments)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
